title: The Biological control of insects
brief_description: Shows some aspects of the entomologist’s work in his attempts to control insect pests by the use of their natural enemies. In telling the story of biological control the following pests are shown in cloe-up: cottony cushion scale, cabbage moth, green vegetable bug, cabbage white butterfly, vegetable weevil and Queensland fruit fly. Their natural enemies include predators, parasites and diseases.
